About Flight Delay Predictor

üöÄ About This Project

The Flight Delay Predictor is an AI-powered web application that helps travelers anticipate potential flight delays before they happen. Using machine learning algorithms and real-time weather data, our system analyzes various factors to provide accurate predictions about flight delays.

This project was developed as a comprehensive machine learning solution that combines data science, web development, and cloud deployment technologies to create a practical tool for air travelers.

‚ú® Key Features

  • üéØ AI-Powered Predictions - Uses Random Forest algorithm for accurate delay predictions
  • üåç Real-time Weather Integration - Incorporates current weather conditions in predictions
  • üè¢ Comprehensive Airport Database - Supports hundreds of airports worldwide
  • üìä Probability Breakdown - Shows likelihood of different delay categories
  • üì± Responsive Design - Works seamlessly on desktop and mobile devices
  • ‚ö° Fast Performance - Optimized for quick predictions and smooth user experience

üìà How It Works

1. Data Collection: The model was trained on historical flight data, including departure times, airports, weather conditions, and actual delay outcomes.

2. Feature Engineering: Key factors like departure hour, origin/destination airports, and weather conditions are processed and encoded for machine learning.

3. Model Training: A Random Forest classifier was trained to predict delay categories: No Delay, Regular Delay (15+ min), Severe Delay (60+ min), and Extreme Delay (180+ min).

4. Real-time Prediction: When you enter flight details, the system fetches current weather data and uses the trained model to predict delay probabilities.

‚ö†Ô∏è Disclaimer

This tool provides predictions based on historical data and current weather conditions. While we strive for accuracy, actual flight delays can be influenced by many factors not captured in our model. Always check with your airline for the most up-to-date flight information.

This project is for educational and demonstration purposes. Use the predictions as guidance only and not as the sole basis for travel decisions.
